meanings.definition: Causing someone to feel drained of energy or vitality.
meanings.sent1: The long hike was enervatingly tiring for the group of friends.
meanings.sent2: The hot weather made the walk enervatingly exhausting.
meanings.sent3: The boring lecture was enervatingly draining for the students.
meanings.sent4: The constant noise in the city was enervatingly sapping their energy.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive tasks at work were enervatingly zapping their vitality.

meanings.definition: In a way that exhausts or weakens someone physically or mentally.
meanings.sent1: She worked enervatingly hard to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent2: The exam was enervatingly difficult for the students.
meanings.sent3: He enervatingly pushed himself to run the marathon.
meanings.sent4: The constant stress was enervatingly wearing her down.
meanings.sent5: The long hours of studying were enervatingly draining his mental strength.
